result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew H Winkler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid in full by 05-05-2017 or suspension of driver's license for up to one year or until paid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court by the State.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Andrew H Winkler in court with attorney Matthew H Huppertz.  

State moves to amend count 1 to a county ordinance of DC.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a  plea of No Contest to the amended count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $236
DV Surcharge:  $100
To be paid in full by:  05/05/17.
Alternate:  DL Suspension.
